meanings.definition: Having or showing a cautious distrust of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She felt suspicious of the new student in class.
meanings.sent2: The detective was suspicious of the man's alibi.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a suspicious look to the empty box.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds overhead cast a suspicious shadow on the town.
meanings.sent5: The old house had a suspicious creaking sound at night.

meanings.definition: Causing one to have the idea or impression that something or someone is questionable, dishonest, or dangerous.
meanings.sent1: The abandoned house had a suspicious atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The strange phone call left her feeling suspicious.
meanings.sent3: The suspicious banana peel made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The flickering streetlight created a suspicious dance of shadows.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious package had a suspicious ticking noise.
